entries.meaning: (medicine) The pathological examination of a corpse, particularly to determine cause of death. [from 19th c.]
examples: Anatomy theory led to morbid anatomy in necropsy studies pursued by, among others, Johann Wepfer (1620–95) and Théophile Bonet (1620–89), both Swiss.

verbs.description: necropsy (third-person singular simple present necropsies, present participle necropsying, simple past and past participle necropsied)

entries.meaning: The act of performing a necropsy.
